page.title: 07SHEFFORD TRAFIC PROBLEMS
page.content: Two main roads go through Shefford. North to South,the A600 which carries about 5,500 vehicles a day and East to West the A507 which carries about 6,500 vehicles a day. The A507 connects the A1 to the M1 and is used by a large number of very large lorries.One vehicle in five is a heavy goods vehicle and altogether 12,000 vehicles a day travel through this small town. Both roads have to cross traffic lights in the centre of the town and there are often traffic jams and long delays. With three schools in the town it is very dangerous having such a lot of traffic and the townspeople have been trying for a long time to get a by-pass.There are posters all over Shefford which say that we need a by-pass now.
